titles: A compendious or briefe examination of certayne ordinary complaints of diuers of our country men in these our dayes which although they are in some part vniust & friuolous, yet are they all by vvay of dialogues throughly debated & discussed. By William Stafford, gentleman.
author: Hales, John, d. 1571, attributed name. aut
Smith, Thomas, Sir, 1513-1577, attributed name.
Stafford, William, 1554-1612.
publisher: In Fleetstreate, neere vnto Saincte Dunstones Church, by Thomas Marshe,
notes: "This was written in 1549; sometimes attributed to John Hales but more probably by Sir Thomas Smith."--STC.
STC suggests William Stafford as editor.
At foot of title: Cum priuilegio.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  Economic conditions --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Edward VI, 1547-1553 --  Early works to 1800.
